00047 int main(int argc, char * argv[]) {
00048         data_collect shm_sem;
00049         int shm_size = 0;
00050         int pos = 0;
00051         int output = -1;
00052         
00053         /*  get size as parameter */
00054         if ((shm_size = parseParameter(argc, argv)) == -1) {
00055                 fprintf(stderr, "Usage: empfaenger -m <ringbuffer size>\n");
00056                 return -1;
00057         }
00058         
00059         /*  create segment/semaphore and return collection or when already created only return collection */
00060         shm_sem = createSegment(shm_size, READ_MODE);
00061         if (shm_sem.segment == NULL) return -1;
00062         
00063         do {
00064                 /* Decrement read semaphore, because we read from a written segment, if >0 all ok else block application */
00065                 while (P(shm_sem.sem_r) == -1) {
00066                         if (errno != EINTR) {
00067                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", "P(shm_sem.sem_r)", strerror(errno));
00068                                 closeSegment(shm_sem);
00069                                 return -1;
00070                         }
00071                         errno = 0;
00072                 }
00073           
00074                 /* get character from shared memory and write to stdout */
00075                 output = shm_sem.segment[pos];
00076                 pos++;
00077                 
00078                 if (output != EOF) {
00079                         if (fputc(output, stdout) == EOF) {
00080                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", "printf()", strerror(errno));
00081                                 closeSegment(shm_sem);
00082                                 return -1;
00083                         }
00084                 }
00085                 
00086                 /* if pos >= shared memory size, start at 0 again */
00087                 if (pos >= shm_sem.shm_size) {
00088                         pos = 0;
00089                 }
00090                 
00091                 /* increment write semaphore to tell sender that segment is read and can be overwritten */
00092                 if (V(shm_sem.sem_w) != 0) {
00093                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", "V(shm_sem.sem_w)", strerror(errno));
00094                         closeSegment(shm_sem);
00095                         return -1;
00096                 }
00097         } while (output != EOF);
00098         
00099         closeSegment(shm_sem);
00100 
00101         return 0;
00102 }
